[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: BatchApprove()] [Partial Failure] If one approve in batch fails, are previous approvals rolled back or do they persist causing inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: UnApprove()] [Zero Amount Spam] No minimum amount check - can attacker spam zero un-approvals to generate event noise? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: Burn()] [IsBurnable Bypass] Check at line 326 validates IsBurnable, but can CrossChainTransfer bypass this by calling Burn internally? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: Burn()] [State Update Missing] After Supply subtraction, SetTokenInfo is not called - can this cause persistent supply inflation? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: Burn()] [Balance-Supply Mismatch] ModifyBalance reduces balance but if it fails, Supply is still decremented causing accounting mismatch? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: CheckThreshold()] [Empty Threshold Bypass] If input.SymbolToThreshold.Count == 0, meetThreshold is set true at line 365 - can this bypass all authorization checks? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: CheckThreshold()] [Allowance Check Bypass] IsCheckAllowance flag allows skipping allowance verification - can malicious contract abuse this to bypass spending limits? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: CheckThreshold()] [Race Condition] Balance and allowance checks are separate from actual transfer - can values change between check and use? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: CheckThreshold()] [Symbol Iteration DOS] If input.SymbolToThreshold contains many symbols, can excessive iteration cause DOS? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: TransferToContract()] [Whitelist Bypass Race] IsInWhiteList check at line 393 can change between check and transfer - can attacker exploit this timing window? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: TransferToContract()] [Allowance Double-Spend] If allowance >= amount, transfer succeeds and allowance is decremented at line 407, but what if allowance was used in parallel transaction? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: TransferToContract()] [Whitelist Authorization] Whitelist members bypass allowance completely - can compromised whitelist member drain user funds? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: TransferToContract()] [DealWithExternalInfo Position] External info processing happens after transfer completes - can reentrancy exploit this ordering? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: AdvanceResourceToken()] [Integer Overflow] State.AdvancedResourceToken addition at line 418-420 - can overflow if repeatedly called with large amounts? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: AdvanceResourceToken()] [DoTransfer Failure Handling] If DoTransfer at line 421 fails after state update, can this cause accounting inconsistency? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.MultiToken/TokenContract_Actions.cs] [Function: AdvanceResourceToken()] [Negative Amount] No validation that input.Amount is positive - can negative amount cause state corruption? (Medium)
